Reviews.Title: A Video Review on the Samsung UN46ES6500
Reviews.Author: CKE

logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_moWLO6EM4425GQcurrentClick) { return cv_moWLO6EM4425GQcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 5:57 MinsThe Samsung 6500 LED 3D TV is a great option for anyone in the market for a mid-point LED television. It offers many of the options of the higher price sets (such as the high-end Samsung 8000 series), but lacks the pricier cutting edge technology (Such as the motion and voice control). Through-out the video portion of this review reference the LG LM6700, which is at a a similar price point.Notes-Picture Quality - It took some tweaking, but once I had it properly set-up the picture quality was very good. The picture is crisp (which you would expect from any 1080P set), but it also offers better brightness than our LG LM6700. The LG always seems a little dark, but the Samsung 6500 offers better overall brightness, and to me, it makes the picture *look* better. One other thing, until I got the picture adjusted properly, I did notice some color blooming which subtracted from the overall picture sharpness... never fear, this can be adjusted out. Some people may also be concerned with the 120Hz refresh.... I also own the Samsung 8000,and my version is 240Hz, and I don't notice any difference. I guess the only time it maybe noticeable is while watching a 3D Blu-ray.3D- The Samsung 6500 comes with 2 pairs of active (read *battery operated*) 3D glasses. Using the Samsung 6500 to convert 2D to 3D works, ok, but it will not take your breath away. I used it to watch a baseball game, and "Men in Black" and while I noticed the difference - it was not dramatic. The LG LM6700 uses passive glasses, and to me, seems to have better 2D to 3D capability.Sound - Again, it took some adjustments to get the integrated speakers to sound the way I wanted. It required me to turn the surround setting on, and play around with the set-up. One thing to note, is that out-of-the-box, the Samsung 6500 makes a clicking noise every time you raise or lower the volume. This is pretty annoying, but it can be disabled.Features - This is what separated the Samsung 6500 from some of the pricier models, but to me, it really doesn't matter. The Samsung comes with a nice programmable remote, plenty of applications (Netflix, Hulu Plus, YouTube, Pandora,...although Amazon is noticeably absent). However, as I mentioned it does not come with the voice and motion control of the Samsung 8000 series. The Samsung 6500 offer "Family View" and Fitness channels... but in all honesty, I really have not used them. In terms of features, the LG LM6700 has very similar features - but they are better organized and easier to use.Back Panel - I mention it in the video portion, but the Samsung 6500 offers 3 HDMI inputs (which is enough for a Game device, DVR, and Blu-Ray... or some other combination), 1 component input, 0 (zero) RCA and S-video inputs, and optical output, a LAN input, and multiple USB inputs. I question why modern TV manufacturers have completely dropped RCA inputs - they still come in handy.Wifi - The Samsung 6500 comes with built-in wifi.Final Verdict - The Samsung 6500 offers a great picture with plenty of apps you would expect. While the LG LM6700 does have it beat on ease of use (it requires a lot less tweaking), but ultimately it can not offer the ultra-bright picture of the Samsung 6500. Is the Samsung 6500 the greatest LED TV on the market... nope, but it may be the best one at this price point!4 1/2 Stars

Reviews.Title: Ultimate Configuration, Awesome 3D with Too many Software Issues
Reviews.Author: Phanindra
Reviews.Content: Let me start with PROSUltimate configuration with awesome 3D experience, super clarity and sound quality. Would buy it again when below issues are resolved.CONS:Hell lot of software Issues:1) All of a sudden Netflix froze and it doesn't respond to any remote control button. I have to power it off and when I power it on with wifi and/or wired connection I see multiple issues as below2) After the above step if i power on my TV it starts with a Green horizontal line on the top edge of the TV3) When ever this happens it loses all my Network settings and it doesn't connect the Smart HUB (Netflix/YouTube). It doesn't even detect my WIFI or a wired LAN connection.4) Whenever YouTube gets stuck/freezes TV doesn't respond to remote control and on restarting the TV wired or wifi connection gets disconnected and doesn't detect wifi or wired LAN connection.5) At times when I watch YouTube TV restarts all of a sudden.6) When ever I restart YouTube if I forward the earlier video I was watching the amount of forwarding/image doesn't match with the time it is buffered for. Ex: Fast forwarding the video for 30 mins approximately shows 1 hour 30 mins on the seek bar of YouTube.7) Netflix doesn't connect thru wifi initially so I have to connect through LAN cable8) 3d doesn't work with NetflixTV Model No: UN46ES6500FXZAVersion No: TS01Serial No: Z4XXXXXXXXX179MBelow are the Transaction numbers for the calls made to Samsung support to resolve. But nothing helps.1) Samsung Transaction No: 2xxxxxxx40 -- Was to reset to factory settings only to see the issues again.2) Samsung Transaction No: 2xxxxxxx603) Samsung Remote Diagnosis Chat Session ID: LTK56xxxxxxxx4X4) Samsung Transaction No: 2xxxxxxx07- Level-1/Tier-1 couldn't help this time. They escalated to Level-2/Tier2 Support & i was put on brief hold every time and I was finally heard from Samsung that the crash & restart are firmware issues are being fixed in an firmware update across E models which is being fixed. Do you want to wait for a fix and live with the issues till you get a firmware update? I wouldn't do that when I am spending so much on a TV.

Reviews.Title: Two star
Reviews.Author: S. kalman "mclare"
Reviews.Content: I decided to actually do a review of the smart TV features since that's what it's sold as, rather than just give it 5 stars and act like "its so cool and good picture, I love my newt TV!!"  I mean if you wanted good picture and nothing more you can get that for $500.  So here goes...My goal was use this TV's features to get all my content from the internet so I could cut the cable and save $900 a year, that's enough to buy a new TV every year.  I was going to use the web browser to visit various TV websites like NBC, PBS, etc. like I do on my computer and view shows that way, instead of cable. I was going to use netflix for other shows and movies, plus the on-demand apps for any movies/shows not on netflix... (and antennas work in my area). Total price for internet plus netflix/onlineTV would be $30/month.  This can supposedly be done with PS3 and xbox; but for those of us who don't play games we don't see a point in buying those devices for simple tasks.Assembly:  You know that problem with the screws not fitting in the stand that they've been having for almost a year now? Well it would have been excusable if this were a new item to hit market; but I bought this thing in August and apparently they're still having the problem.  I wasn't going to wait 2 weeks for them to ship new screws so I pushed hard and jammed them in,that seems to work.First turning it on:  The thing asks to Update; say "YES!!!".  I didn't at first which meant each time I tried a feature it had to update that individual feature.  The whole process of waiting for updates took about an hour.  I tried going to manual update but the whole screen went blank each time I tried that; I had no idea what was going on.  I decided to just leave it on for 30 min on the blank screen and see if would update; well apparently it did, then I had to turn it off and back on again to receive any acknowledgment from the TV.  All around the whole interface it extremely buggy at first, and gets a little less buggy with the update.  I tried the MSNBC App first, it worked Ok for a while then started having buffering problems then crashed.  Thats what it does. I don't know why these apps are so buggy its not rocket science to make an app. Netflix doesn't seem to have a way to browse by category like it has on the computer and iphone. You have to use the slow letter-by-letter search feature to find movies or just watch what it suggests to you from you're queue or whatever, not a huge problem, but slightly annoying and easily fixable by Netflix and Samsung if they choose. Netflix crashes a few times a day.Web browsing:  The web browser actually works better than other reviewers are giving it credit for.  I'm still pissed at it but Ill explain later.  You need a smart phone, ipad or keyboard for it to be practical.  You must download the remote app to your phone and then you can type into the browser, search and navigate fast using the iphone keyboard. After using it a while I got pretty good at it and learned some of the quick keys on the remote; keep playing with it if you're having problems.  It is a basic browser, it can watch some of the video on bing, I can watch all the videos on yahoo news.  I tried going to Pbs.org and it couldn't read any of the video.  This is a problem for me as I find no excuse for it.  My cheap little phone can watch all the video on pbs and just about any other site, but my TV, can't. What kind of a TV has trouble with video?  That's all it does... is play video, and yet it sucks when compared to a phone or my 5 year old laptop.  The remote app is basically the same as the regular TV remote (other than the browser keyboard).  The app comes with a laptop-like track pad that would be really nice for moving the cursor around the screen if it actually worked.I was looking for ways to visit the websites on my computer, hit full screen and stream to the TV. I had to buy a $100 Diamond USB transmitter that adds the TV as a second monitor; For example if I want to watch last nights TV episodes, I load website video on laptop browser, drag window to TV and hit full screen; It works;  but what sucks is I didn't have to buy a $1,100 TV if I was going to do that, any TV can do that.Sound is great.  This was important to me.  I'm a minimalist and didn't want to buy the whole home theater just to get decent sound, its not like my life revolves around TV.  Most if not all the 2012 TVs suck this year, and sound is one of their weakest points.  CR rated Samsung's sound really good and that factored into my decision.A lot of people who haven't done their research like to know about the picture. So I'll teach you how to shop for picture quality.  In the year 2012 you don't need to worry about picture quality.  The manufacturers have mostly mastered this.  TVs are basically divided into a few classes, low end LCD, high end LCD, and plasma.  So for picture all you have to ask is "am I willing to settle for low end LCD, like Westinghouse and other cheap brands", and "do I like the plasma look or LCD look better?"  and last do you want glossy screen or matte screen?  So if you're stressing over whether Lg, Panasonic, Sony or Samsung has a better picture you're wasting your time, they are all roughly the same, they are all excellent; in fact many of the displays are made under the same joint patents, in the same factory, on the same assembly line. So if you see a difference in the store models it is probably just the settings that make them look different.I give it 2 stars because I don't see much excuse for its pitfalls. It's pitfalls cause major inconveniences and yet are really easy for Samsung to fix. I don't think I'm asking a lot that my $1100 TV can play all the internet videos that my $150 phone can play.  I mean this TV costs as much as a computer, a fancy computer at that. TVs with apps have been out for years. The apps should work flawlessly at this point, and they should have extremely advanced features.  My parents bought a Samsung a few years ago and it does everything this one does except browse the web.  I also knock a lot of stars off for false marketing.  I hate it when companies lie, saying their product has all kinds of features that really are very buggy or done half-ass, poorly updated.  What do they think I'm going to do with a browser built into my TV?  Read?  No, the only purpose it serves is to watch videos on websites.  So don't say you have an internet browser when it only views everything but video.  If your goal is to just buy it plug it into a cable and BD you'll be fine, it's cheaper than Sony and at the time of writing this Samsung seems to have better Quality control than Lg so buggy smart features aside, it's OK.In my research I had narrowed it down to 2 TVs based on smart features, this one and the Panasonic. These are rated as having the best smart features of all the TVs out there. The Panasonic has slightly better 3d quality, but slightly worse sound quality, a glossy screen which I hate, and the browser was rated a wee bit better in Samsung; the Panasonic is also 100-200 cheaper than this one. I've found in my research I can't have my cake and eat it too, there is no TV 40-46" that has it all.  You have to pick and choose and sacrifice one feature for another. Supposedly if you're willing to buy bigger TVs the features are all around better, it seems that's where companies are putting their best resources.  For me Samsung had the best sound hands down, and supposedly the best smart features so that's what I got.Update: It's over a year later.  Samsung has updated the software on the TV several times and added bugs each time.  I have to sign into Netflix every time I use it.  Unlike Vizio Samsung doesn't have a full keyboard on the remote and the phone app was never updated to get one. So.. this is very time consuming.  Lots of people having this issue and Samsung refuses to address it. I didn't realize before that in order to use any of the apps, netflix etc..  It has to connect to Samsung's servers; so when Samsung's servers are down, your TV is down.  This is so they can gather info about what you watch.  They've kept their marketing/personal-info-gathering features updated fine, but not any features that would apply to you. After buying many buggy Samsung products this year, none of which were new models, I'm disgusted with Samsung as a company and will try to avoid their products in the future.  They could fix most their issues with simple software updates, but for some reason they don't.

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture after simple adjustment
Reviews.Author: S. Edelstein
Reviews.Content: This TV has an excellent picture, period. If your main criteria for a TV is the picture then I don't think you can go wrong with this TV.Now some background...Out of the box, news shows were unwatchable while movies and most other programming were great. Just about every news show was overly bright and faces so much so it was unwatchable as far as I was concerned. But two simple adjustments fixed it.Using the Natural setting I dialed back Brightness from 45 to 35 and Color from 52 to 40. Now there are a zillion other controls and the picture can be tweaked endlessly. But those two probably made 90% of the diference with 10% of the effort. You will want to adjust the settings to your preference but Color and Brightness is definitely the place to start.Pros:- Great picture- Great use of the overall dimension. The overall size is a bit smaller than our previos 40 inch Samsung. But the outer bezel is so narow that the it's mostly screen. So we have a 46 inch TV in a 40 inch space as far as I'm concerned.-Desent sound. The speakers are on the back and reflect against the rear wall giving a pretty full sound. But for full sound we use our external surround system.- Easy setup- Stylish look.Cons:- I would have liked RCA audio outputs. But there are none.- Universal remote operation with DIsh Network is lame. Missing is single button access to the Guide.

Reviews.Title: Great TV once you get in there
Reviews.Author: Riverz
Reviews.Content: I chose this tv over the lg 6700 after comparing the two at a retail store. Out of the box, the picture was just horrible and there was alot of bleeding around the corners; it initially looked like I would have to return it. However, after a lot of tweaking and tuning, I got it to look fantastic. Motion is smooth, picture is crisp and natural-looking, and I even managed to drastically reduce the bleeding (its still noticeable during scenes where the corners are really really dark, but you have to look for it to notice). I ordered a calibration blu-ray disc which will hopefully help a bit more with the picture fidelity.The apps aren't that useful and can't compete with the offerings of a gaming console (I have my PS3 and Xbox360 hooked up to it). I don't ever see myself using any of the onboard apps. (netflix was pretty solid and standard, but viewing it on the tv means you have to readjust the picture settingsGaming is really great, but once again you have to dive into the settings and fiddle around with them to get the right image.The 3-d viewing of 3d content was really impressive. 3d games on my playstation especially blew me away. 2d to 3d conversion is  much more hit or miss though. There are many moments where the added depth looks realistic (especially while gaming) but most of the time it isn't really that convincing and tends to result in a wicked headache after a while. Another gripe that I have is the positioning of the inputs. Two of the HMDI ports along with the component ports stick out of the back, rather than the side of the unit. It's not a problem for me because I haven't mounted it, but it's worth mentioning as a heads up to those who plan to.All in all though, once you rough it out, massage the settings, and give it some elbow grease, this is simply an awesome television. I'm very happy with my purchase.Now hopefully it doesnt break down (knocks on wood).

Reviews.Title: Goofy Stand
Reviews.Author: Carlos Aona "KabarKing"
Reviews.Content: I received the 46" 3D HD TV today. I set it up and had it running in 45 minutes. It replaced my older Samsung TV which was still in good condition. Contrary to what I have heard, this TV has a great sound. I may not hook up my Speaker Bar. Contrary to what I'v read, the picture is excellent. I have two gripes: The literature does not say which Key Boards (Brand / model) work with the TV other than Samsung --that sells for around a hundred bucks. Issue Two: The attachment of the stand to the TV is 100% junk. I mean garbage, tin foil, refuse designed by a madman. To attach it one must lay the TV on its face and attach the stand with four screws. If the four TANGS do not all engage properly, the TV leans so badly it might fall over. It's a good TV BUT BEST BUY has dropped it this week. A 47" model apparently replaced it. ALSO Samsung NOW sells this online for $969.99 as of this week with FREE shipping.

Reviews.Title: Wifi is Awful, customer support is even worse
Reviews.Author: Lina
Reviews.Content: Built in Wifi is awful!  I purchased the TV, and three months later, the wifi card stopped working.  Since I am overseas, and purchased this TV in the US, I had to take it in to the Samsung repair center.  After paying $200 to change the wifi card, the thing stopped working after another three months.  Samsung tech support mentioned there was a known issue with this series of TV's.  At the end, after at least 5 hours on the phone and another 5 hours in Live Chat, I asked tech support if buying a Samsung Linkstick  Samsung WIS12ABGNX Wireless LAN Adapter(for TV's that do not have built in wifi) would resolve the issue.  It did....however, after purchasing what at the time was a $2,000 TV, I had to invest another $240 to finally enjoy its internet capability.  If you plan on using wifi, try another model, or buy the Link Stick when you buy the TV.Two Months LaterUpdate......now it won't connect to the internet, even using the Link Stick!  After 6 hours with Samsung customer support, I gave up and returned the TV.  Last Samsung TV I ever buy.  Samsung's answer was to hard wire the TV with Ethernet....if this had been an option, I would have bought a cheaper tv, or harwired my Blu Ray player....very disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Samsung FTW!!!
Reviews.Author: H2O
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd Samsung TV and by far the best. Samsung is still ahead of the curve when it comes to TV's!I have a 26 inch Samsung TOC T260HD that I use as a monitor and I had a 40 inch LCD for about 3 yrs which performed flawlessly.  I finally decided I should get a LED TV because it was @ a great price, which was actually cheaper than the version w/o 3D at Best Buy.I'm extremely happy with my purchase. Picture is amazing and it's so thin it almost disappears when looking at it from the side :)Netflix and HBOGo are by far my favorite apps and the only app I wish they had that they don't is Amazon's video app. It's actually the only complain I have about this TV which really doesn't lie on the TV itself but more on Samsung and perhaps Amazon's developers.Setting up wifi was a breeze. I changed 2 default features it came with which i didn't like; turned off CMR, which gives it the "soap opera effect" and the auto dimming. From box to having it exactly like I wanted it took less than 15 minutes.Samsung FTW!!!

Reviews.Title: Netflix doesn't work on this model
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "caltonia"
Reviews.Content: The app will launch, but only 1 in 20 times will it play a video. The rest of the time it errors out "We're having trouble playing this title right now. Please select a different title." I try a different one. Same problem. No title works without having to try and select it 20+ times. It's not just the one I've selected. This problem is also only happening on this model (we have 4 of them, but only one is this model). Somewhere the software for this one isn't working right. I've tried reinstalling the app. No change. I've turned it off and on. No change. I've tried logging out and logging back in. No change. The app is completely broken on this model.Update 1/10/12:With the latest SW update, this model has been reduced to a glorified monitor. I can still access network drives, but the smart functionality is totally gone. It reports network not connected, but using it's verify network settings, I can see they're fine (plus, I can get access to network drives). It's only the Smart functionality that's dead. Resetting to factory settings didn't help at all.I sure hope this doesn't happen with the other models... We have 3 different ones, which I'll report on if they do.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN46ES6500 46" 1080p 3D LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: Sandy at the beach "Martha"
Reviews.Content: I don't understand why this TV is getting any negative reviews.  The picture is unbelievable and the only adjustment I made was to change the picture mode to Natural.  All of the other settings look fantastic.  The TV is connected to a built-in WIFI AT&T; Uverse receiver and set-up was effortless.  The Smart TV is excellent and Amazon Prime instant videos stream flawlessly.  I also purchased Finding Nemo in 3D.  Having never watched anything in 3D previously, I didn't know what to expect.  I'd rather not have to wear the glasses, but they were OK.  The movie was incredible in 3D.  This is a beautiful television.  I highly recommend it.  It's my third Samsung TV.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: A1DZXD
Reviews.Content: I have the 46 inch and I love it I mainly use to play video games and watching movies. First off for gaming it works great there s no lag and graphics are amazing for 3d gaming some look good but certain games don't do it to well like black ops. Movies look amazing also I watched avengers, dark night, amazing Spiderman details and color pop and with 3d some details pop more. I had one complaint about the TVs which was the dimming part and what it would do is go really dark on scenes were there was little light. Saying that there's a option were u could set it off so I was happy. The smart feat are not amazing but they work and for the prize it's not bad. The 3d glasses are comfortablewhich is great for long time uses and just in case your wondering if it needs batteries yes it does it's the circle batteries I forget what there call but there the rounded ones. Overall I love this tv and I would recommended for those who need a Tv upgrade but they don't want to spent to much for a good brand tv.

Reviews.Title: A+ Screen
Reviews.Author: LaughingLion "I am Lion, read me review!"
Reviews.Content: I hate the fact that it updates apps so often.I love that I can view my Amazon Prime videos.Screan is great, audio is great, and it is even possible to control it when you can't find your remote using the toggle switch  on the back.

Reviews.Title: great TV
Reviews.Author: Michael R. Dickman
Reviews.Content: This is  a great TV for the money!  As noted by other reviewers it is necessary to tweak the picture to get the full effect of this TV.  Here is a link to the settings that I used with very minor changes:  http://reviews.lcdtvbuyingguide.com/samsung-lcd-tv/samsung-es6500-picturesettings.html  There are also several options for the sound including an audio delay setting that lets you get perfect lip sync which sometimes is elusive in HDTV.  I was afraid of motion blur as I moved from a DLP driven HDTV (which has zero motion blur) but this has not been a problem even with the fastest sports action (hockey fan here) which can stress a TV's motion blur problems.  Over all, great TV, glad I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN46ES6500 46-Inch 1080p 120Hz 3D Slim LED HDTV (Black)
Reviews.Author: Mebu Barday
Reviews.Content: This one does not have the silver trim as shown in brackets it is black. For the silver I was not willing to pay extra. My real need was the 2D to 3D conversion so I could watch all my 2D favorites in 3D. Word of caution here, 2D to 3D is not top of the line but it does do a fairly good job. I have even watched some of my favorite TV shows in 2D-3D mode and enjoy them.3D is awesome, If you saw Avatar 3D in the theater and remember how the Ava's flowers came floating towards you when it came around on Jack Sulley, yes its that good.The next big reason for getting Samsung is cause I have 3D DVD/Blue-ray player by Samsung and it makes it easy to integrate these units when you stay with the same brand. Yes you have to have a 3D Blue-ray or DVD player to watch the 3D movies. The 3D technology is reversible. That is you can convert  3D-2D if you end up having guests and don't have enough 3D glasses.Picture quality is great but the sound is from really small speakers so I have for now an external amp. You should know though that hooking up an external amp without the HDMI cable wont let you control the volume through TV remote. You will have to do that through the amp control or manually. I strongly recommend you use external speakers if you like higher volume or the bass will sound like someone knocking on the wall.If you want a good sound and want to control it with your TV remote then get Samsung Sound bar and some are really a good deal on Amazon. I like mine to be a surround sound system. So when I upgrade to 65 or 80 inch Samsung TV in a couple of years, I will get that system. In these sound systems look for one feature you must have and that is HDMI cable connection. The TV remote will integrate through  it.Another really good thing I like about Samsung is you can chat with their Techs on line 24/7. So when I had issues with the sound I chat-ed with them they walked me through without rushing me and that's when I discovered my amp should have HDMI out in order to have TV control the amp. Word of caution here: The tech at the other end is there to help you so don't take out your frustration on them. Be nice state your problem and answer their question without adding gory details. They are only trying to troubleshoot the issue. At the end if you fill out a two minute survey, they will even email you the Chat conversation.The auto back-light adjust that adjusts automatically to the room illumination is a joke. I left mine on manual.Apart from that I like to view my PowerPoints and home video from my computer on big screen. I am not very savvy on wireless connections so I ordered VGA to HDMI converter to match computer to TV. Besides I really don't want my TV to be connected to the internet. Computer getting viruses is enough for me :). Any ways my next computer will also have HDMI out on it :).See you are now in the digital technology so anything you have analog is not going to fit like a glove. Once you start going digital you will eventually need to upgrade your equipments to digital. Until then you will end up having to make-do.Most other points are covered by other writers so I will leave it at that and update if I find something new.Hope that helps.

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: Adam H Risser
Reviews.Content: Looks great, but the smart tv features are dog slow and really crappy. Would have gave it 5/5 if not for that

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: sr "sr"
Reviews.Content: The smart hub is finally worth it once they added the amazon app.  If I had to do it again, I would get the dual core model, as the app speed does seem to be impacted by having only one processor.There are constant firmware updates, that have to get applied once a week or so.  The smart hub always seems to need an update,.  That can get annoying.Other than that, a decent replacement for my Sony Bravia.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN60ES6500- Smart Hub/ Apps very unstable
Reviews.Author: Samsung TV User
Reviews.Content: Samsung UN60ES6500- Smart Hub/ Apps very unstable. restarts very often. YouTube and netflix unstable. The picture freezes, audio goes out of sync. TV restarts when using the Applications mainly when watching online videos.

Reviews.Title: Firmware upgrade removes need for tuning
Reviews.Author: Chase
Reviews.Content: Ok so you see the reviews on here telling you how to tune your tv to make it AMAZING. Well thats not necessary anymore. The tv will need to be upgraded to firmware ending in xxxxxxx27 or higher and RIGHT OUT OF THE BOX this thing POPS. And if you go in and turn on Clear Motion (which is all i had to do for Call of Duty) then you have a cinema or better quality in your living room. And please dont listen to the whiners complaining about the volume clicky noise when you turn the volume up, its barely noticable unless your in the 50's range.....Pros: everythingCons: Nothing.

Reviews.Title: THIS TV IS AWESOME !!!!
Reviews.Author: Hary
Reviews.Content: First of all its Samsung and you can never go wrong with a Samsung Smart TV. Its clarity is simply superb. Definitely better than Sony and on par with LG. It has got Active 3D which is really a cool feature. but at times it may induce headache if you watch continuously for more than few hours.Yes! the 3D glasses need a button battery to work. The batteries last for 30 hrs minimum.. The TV come with 2 glasses. Incase you wanna buy extra glasses they are available in Best Buy at $19/glass.The HD clarity is simply great.TV is easy to assemble. No Doubt.Cons: 1 feature I was little disappointed about is, though its a smart tv it does not come with a smart remote control. A LG tv with the same specification comes with a smart remote control. That was one main feature why I was kind of inclined towards LG.. But Hey its Samsung man.. Market leader in electronics... excepts for certain products.In fact I even felt ES6500 is better than certain other high end samsung models which are few 100 dollars more. When I bought there was an offer and I got it very cheap around.. Great discounts.. (I clearly remember it was not Thanks giving or Xmas.. it was some time in feb)One more thing I learned when I was researching for buying tvs. The price of TV is same across all shops like - Target, sears, walmart, best buy, and even amazon. There is no difference between the price online and stores (hardly may be $3 difference). Its been standardized by the industry that the price remains same every where.I would not have asked for more.. This TV is simply awesome.. I love my TV.. :)

Reviews.Title: It's like a 46" Galaxy S4 !!!
Reviews.Author: Rubab Khan
Reviews.Content: I had very high expectation before the units arrived, but it easily met and beat all my expectations easily.First, the packaging was great. The usual TV box was put in a much lager brown box and packed very carefully and with a lot of protection. Not a scratch anywhere inside.Next, setting up was quick and easy. After connecting to the net, the TV took about half an hour to update everything, and I had to access most of teh features in Smart Hub one at a time to update everything, but that's okay. It is not much different than first time turning on a laptop or Smart phone.Then, it paired without any complaints with both my HTC one and my wife's S4 without any complaint. In fact, my friend brought over an iPhone just to see if Apple plays well with Samsung here, and it did! All you have to do is to search for "Samsung smart" in any app store for all the great free apps.Finally, cough up a few bucks for a  few extra apps, and your world will become perfect.BTW, although getting a wireless keyboard may seem like a good idea, since the on screen keyboard is annoying, you shouldn't bother about that if you have a smart phone.=====Verdict:Best smart TV and Best value. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: Just what I was looking for and more
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv in like new condition, and it looked brand new to me. I have used this tv for 7 months, and enjoy the smart tv functionality including the auto-dimming feature which works extremely well in the bright room I have it in.

Reviews.Title: nice deal for 2012
Reviews.Author: Daya "IamMe"
Reviews.Content: I liked it so much....though I missed a cam with this product, another near similar product which my friend bought came with that.

Reviews.Title: the TV can be fixed Samsung is the problem.
Reviews.Author: Mike M "Mike"
Reviews.Content: I purchased my Samsung 46ES6500 as an own box never sold in store display. The price was excellent and I had been assured it was mfg certified as working properly.  My first problem was a remote that did not work. I contacted customer service and submitted the information requested and was assured by the Samsung rep it works arrive in a week.  After 2 weeks I called and they pulled up my request and was advised there was a number missing from my request.I asked at what point they would have contacted me and I got no response. The remote was delivered within the week. My next encounter was the sound cutting out in the digital bands on cable systems using pcm sound encoding that requires me to plug and unplug my tv to cycle the tv through a hard reset. When I contacted customer support they advised me it was a cable tv problem and when I asked why it worked after I did a hard reset in my tv. Again there was no response.The tv has flaws that are difficult to get resolved through Samsung customer service.  I will soon have to battle to get my sound problem fixed but it shouldn't be a battle to expect a new tv to work properly.

Reviews.Title: Great tv.
Reviews.Author: Sue Vue
Reviews.Content: I love this TV.  It was great.  The only thing I got to say is that when they deliver it to my house.  They didn't even rang the door bell.  I was home all day waiting for it.  My little girl went out side and saw the box sitting on the step and tell me about it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Mahmud Khalid
Reviews.Content: The picture is great. It is bright and looks great in daylight also.The Smart TV is not that great. It is works sometimes. I use the Amazon TV app and sometimes it does not connect.Don't know exactly where the problem lies but the Sony Blue-ray player seems to connect to Amazon TV perfectly.I like the slim Bezel and it is light which makes it easy to move around and mount on the wall.The sound on the TV is not great. The 3D feature was okay as the technology is still in its infancy.Overall I like the TV because the picture is great.

Reviews.Title: Regards
Reviews.Author: child_jl
Reviews.Content: good morningThe television this one good and in perfect conditionsAdo that refer says goodbye of youJose Diaz

Reviews.Title: Samsung
Reviews.Author: David S. Robinson
Reviews.Content: This tv is worth every penny. Got it on sale right after the super-bowl which was $100 cheaper. Great picture and enough settings to satisfy. Plenty of connections and the 3d is a nice bonus. Though I don't use it all the time but its a nice feature for an every now and then watch. Specs are amazing & most others on the market can't match. Using my amazon card qualified for special financing offer which is o interest for 24 months. Split between my fiance, this is my cheapest bill which won't kill my budget at all. Simple setup and ease of use. Still haven't played around with all the smart hub functions yet. Really only use it for Pandora, sometimes redbox instant & cnet. There are plenty of other streaming video apps but still seems like no one can get youtube right. The best one so far seems to be 360 (if you pair it with a keyboard) but that shouldn't deter anyone from this tv. Must buy.

Reviews.Title: loud background
Reviews.Author: Delos Sheff
Reviews.Content: this tvs background is so loud you can't hear the words. I have to turn it up 60 on the volume just to be able to hear the people talk.  Not real happy with it. Amazon and net flix, while watching the movies, they freeze up. I then have to start it all over until it freezes again after a few hours.  Thinking about going back to my old tv. Never had problems with it.  The color is fabulous though.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely stunning 3D!
Reviews.Author: orchard
Reviews.Content: This HDTV came bundled with a Samsung 3D WIFI Blu-Ray player and when a 3D movie is played the 3D is just fabulous.  I would have never dreamed that it could be that good.  I'm a little hearing impaired and sometimes I use closed captioning.  With a 3D movie the captioning appears to be in the middle of my living room.I bought a keyboard for this, too, and it works well.  I can read my newspaper or check the weather or any number of other things without having to start up my computer.Very well designed!

Reviews.Title: Not as Nice as 2 years ago
Reviews.Author: erictepe
Reviews.Content: So I purchased this set to replace a Panisonic LED LCD that had issues keeping up with sports. You can see that review here: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00752RABI/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_hst_1. I then put up the extra $$$ for this set as I have a 2yo version of the Samsung 6500 series in my living room. That 55" has an incredible picture, smooth motion for sports and very little lag when playing Xbox. This 46" is a totally different story. The screen uniformity was not very good as it had flashlighting in all 4 corners that you could see in dark scenes and 2 clouds, one of which would show through dark scenes. Not good. I will have to say sports looked incredible on this. No issues with any of the NFL playoff games or college basketball. I did not watch any standard TV, network HD TV or BluRay so I cannot comment on that. As this was purchased to play Xbox and watch sports, the issue came with playing Xbox. I found that there was significant lag even when in "game mode". It did not matter what cable you used (HDMI vs Component), there was lag. It became very apparent when playing Rock Band. The notes vertically would look clear then start to smear together then clear up. This does not happen on my other Samsung 6500 TV. I saw some weird artifacts while playing "The Walking Dead" as well. I really wanted this TV to work but unfortunately it went back. I will give Amazon 5 stars as they are incredible to work with for purchases like this.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: John Culpepper
Reviews.Content: The TV fulfills my expectations at good price. Great picture and functions.I like the Smart Hub feature which is very usable.

Reviews.Title: Great upgrade
Reviews.Author: Fhort
Reviews.Content: product arrived on time, the tv set itself up with a few simple input from me and the picture is great

Reviews.Title: Perfect value for Money!
Reviews.Author: AmitM
Reviews.Content: works as expected. deducted a star for the smart TV which is not perfect. browser is slow and operating the browser is a big pain. otherwise this is a great tv, great quality and super slim. I just wish the smart tv had better apps and was easy to operate.

Reviews.Title: Here It Goes
Reviews.Author: Billee
Reviews.Content: This is my first review, so here it goes. The model i got is UNES6580F, everything is the same but its a diff. model # because i got it at costco. The 3d works great and the picture quality is super awesome. It's exactly what i expected. However, i gave it 4 stars because there did happen to be some problems dealing with the streaming. I tried listening to music by connecting my labtop through the tv and for some reason it can read it fine, and it can play it. But after a few seconds it would freeze for about a minute and says it can no longer read it. I was a bit disappointed but i got over it. I used the netflix app on the tv, and it won't play anything in HD. Thank goodness i have a blu ray player because when i play it through the blu ray player, it works in HD. Suffice to say, the sound quality also sucks so i got some speakers, i'm just waiting to get a receiver in the meantime. Besides these issues, everything else works awesome!. Again, the picture quality is perfect and amazing. I hope this helped anyone.

Reviews.Title: Excelente TV
Reviews.Author: RIXIO JOSÉ RODRiGUEZ RODRIGUEZ "RIXIO"
Reviews.Content: El tv es excelente, la imagen Y el sonido es muy bueno tanto en 2D como en 3D, en cuanto a la tienda les recomiendo que le compren el TV a amazon ya que si por alguna razon el tv biene dañado no se le puede solicitar a la tienda que lo cambie ya que si lo hacen le descuentan 50 dolares del monto pagado. por otra parte si esta situacion se presenta con amazon ellos regresan el dinero completo.The tv is excellent, the picture and sound is very good in both 2D and 3D, as to the store I recommend that you buy the TV from Amazon because if for some reason the tv biene damaged may be asked not to the shop to change it because if you do deduct $ 50 of the amount paid. Moreover, if this situation occurs with amazon they return full money.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Picture
Reviews.Author: C. Lyles
Reviews.Content: This TV works great.  The picture is amazing and it has great viewing angles. You can watch it from any angle you can see the screen. The smart TV works well. As of this review the Amazon Instant video App doesn't work. The Youtube app is ok, somewhat laggy even with a connection speed of 15 mbps. Internet browsing with the remote is a little clunky, but its a TV not a computer.I would highly recommend buying this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality
Reviews.Author: Millie Morrow
Reviews.Content: I purchased this a few weeks ago, so have had a chance to test out the picture quality, though not used the 3D functionality yet.We upgraded from an old 32" Hitachi plasma TV which we'd had for several years (cost us a fortune, as plasmas did back then!), but we wanted to get another great TV that would last for several more years, which is why we chose the 3D version. We're not big 3D fans, but for the extra money, it seemed worth it.We use an Apple TV with our Samsung TV and are very pleased with the results. The picture quality is excellent (after a few adjustments), and the sound is pretty good. We also connect our MacBook Pro up to the TV to view Amazon Prime stuff, and the quality is great also.The TV is nice and slim, and although TVs seem to be getting bigger and bigger, the 46" is a nice size and doesn't seem to take over the whole room.We're very pleased with our purchase and would recommend this to others wanting a high quality TV.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 6500
Reviews.Author: michael a burton
Reviews.Content: Purchased as an open box. Item came in Perfect condition. Shipping company(AIT logistics) left some to be desired in timeliness and communication. Took over a week to contact me; then another week to deliver. Tv has great features and works flawlessly. very pleased with purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great product for the price
Reviews.Author: N. Ranganathan
Reviews.Content: I was really amazed when Amazon gave me this product for a great price... The item was delivered as mentioned in the order.. There are lot of features in the Samsung TV and streaming to this TV from different products using Samsung All Share software is amazing...Excellent picture quality, sound and features...Highly recommend this product..

Reviews.Title: Cool
Reviews.Author: Gerald L. Litzza "Jerry"
Reviews.Content: Works fine and has more features than we will use.  I appreciate the multple HDMI inputs (3) and teh ARC connectivity to our Onkyo reciever.  Works great.

Reviews.Title: gotta love it!
Reviews.Author: B.D. Darling
Reviews.Content: This is our first HDTV flat screen tv, and this is a layman's reviews.  There are other excellent reviews that are very technical in nature, that I found helpful before ordering this TV.  What I can report is that my husband--who is oddly not that much into technology--LOVES this TV.  He's a sports fan and can't wait to watch his first football game on this set.  We got it hooked up last night to our HD provider, and we couldn't believe the 1080 pixel resolution.  We watched an episode on Yellowstone Nat'l Park on PBS's Nature and could not believe how absolutely stunning the picture was.  We felt like we were right there in the park.  I didn't buy the TV for the 3D, and didn't have high expectations, but I have to say that that too exceeded all expectations and my kids and I love the 3D.  My husband will probably be caught wearing 3D glasses to watch sports from now on.  We just bought 2 more pairs of 3D glasses.The TV arrived in its box in excellent condition, btw, as I was a little concerned about delivery during the holiday season and the TV getting tossed around.  I'm not sure what upgraded delivery means--it came standard UPS--but was fine.  The TV is also so light that my 10 year old and I could pick it up and put it on our entertainment center ourselves.  A pair of glasses was defective--the battery wouldn't go in right--but amazon was quick to replace them.  Thank you, amazon!Not sure how much we'll use the SmartHub features--the internet seemed a little slow on our wireless connection--but it's nice to have and now I can easily order PPV movies.  We are looking forward to discovering more features of this TV.  It's a great choice, as far as I'm concerned.  And the size of 46" is perfect for our family room, not big--maybe 300 square feet?

Reviews.Title: Excellent for the money!
Reviews.Author: John G. Skinner "hhibrit"
Reviews.Content: The main reason anyone buys a TV is to watch Satellite/Cable, DVD/Blu Ray or Netflix.Here is the crunch. The quality of the image on screen is really dependent on the quality of the input! If you are using a "cheap" dvd/bluray player don't expect stunning picture quality. Most reviewers don't mention anything about peripheral equipment so you really have to take any quality issues with a "pinch of salt".I have just demoted my 40" Sony Backlit LED to the Master Bedroom. My Living room now has the Samsung TV coupled with a Yamaha YRS 700 home theatre system and  an Oppo BDP 93 Blu Ray Player (3D). Picture quality is stunning with 3D, DVD, Satellite and Netflix (that was a surprise!) and way better than the Sony!.I only have one criticism and that is, with 3D it is prone to ghosting. This is because the refresh rate is 120 Hz. With active 3D, your 3d glasses alternate between the 2 3D images so therefore your brain interprets this as a refresh rate of 60 Hz per image. Unfortunately a lot of people are able to detect this so you will see motion blur. Ideally anything over 75 Hz is undetectable, so TV's with a refresh rate of 160 and up look a lot smoother.Now  the big question....Smart TV/Internet surfing. I watch TV/Movies on the TV and use my Macbook Air or iPad for surfing. My Oppo Blu Ray player is fabulous for Netflix/Hulu etc.I have also tried the TV with a Sony BDP S90 ($160.00) and the picture quality was almost as good as the Oppo ($700.00+)The Oppo is way better with internet applications.For the Money this is an incredible TV, and it comes with 2 pairs of 3D glasses (extra glasses are under $18.00 on Amazon).Word of warning!  Blu Ray is not a standardized format. There are many proprietary formats out there. Make sure you do perform regular firmware updates otherwise some disks will not play properly, if they play at all.

Reviews.Title: I am so happy I bought this TV
Reviews.Author: TSForrest
Reviews.Content: I spent more than two weeks researching TV's from most of all the name brands. I kept coming back to Samsung when it came down to the features that were important to me. Here are some of the features that brought me to purchase this TV:- Quality picture - This is a show stopper. Any TV must have a great Full HD picture, true color representation, a suitable refresh rate of 120Hz or better- Good 3D - Important, but not as important as 2D picture quality. Let's face it... 3D is cool, but the vast majority of what I will watch will be 2D. However, when some really good 3D movie is available, I want to be able to have a top-notch 3D experience.- Smart TV features with built-in WiFi (Wireless-N required). I have an Xbox 360, which I use for Netflix, Xfinity TV, and other access to streaming media. In the near future, I may move my Xbox to another location, and I don't want to lose that functionality. Plus, I really like the ability to do other things, such as updating the firmware over the Internet. I also like the ability to do quick Internet surfing. Since buying this TV, I bought a small bluetooth keyboard/touch pad combo (several for under $25), which gives me a much nicer way to surf the Internet, which I cannot do from my Xbox (at this time, might come to Xbox later). I also have a Samsung blu-ray player, which integrates nicely with this TV. It does a lot of little things behind the scenes to make using the blu-ray player easier and nicer than on other TV's.Overall, I am very pleased with this TV. The only thing I ever wonder if I should have done differently was to go with a bigger screen size, but that is all I wonder about my decision to buy this TV.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware - Internet browser is useless, no Amazon video access
Reviews.Author: anonymous
Reviews.Content: This review is about the Samsung 46" E series 6500, or "Smart TV".  I would rename it "dumb TV".  DO NOT BUY THIS IF YOU WANT TO USE THE INTERNET OR AMAZON VIDEOS. BAIT AND SWITCH!!!! Yes the video quality and sound quality and physical features are beautiful. It's a wonderful technologically advanced product for cable TV.  BUT.  We bought this solely because it was advertised as "easy web browsing" with "full web browser" and we wanted to specifically use it to watch Amazon Instant Video. My husband looked at multiple reviews and found a website which listed the product as offering Amazon Instant Video.  When it arrived, we found out that (1) The Amazon App is removed, actually gone since the fall of 2011, from all 2012 Smart TV models.  (2) You cannot access Amazon videos on the web browser because the Web browser (called "Smarthub") is horrible and crashes constantly.  Even Youtube hardly worked.  (3) YOu cannot navigate the web browser with the remote because the buttons on the remote simply don't function well enough (i.e. trying to sign into Amazon took over 30 minutes). (4) A Samsung wireless keyboard was available only briefly this spring but is now "off the market" and unavailable in the U.S.  ALL of these problems are widely reported on CNET and other tech websites but not mentioned on the Amazon reviews at all.  Someone developed an Iphone app to try to solve problem 3 and 4 in the fall of 2011 but it is now "defective" and will not work, even though you can download it.  This is a nightmare.  Why would we want a 1200 dollar internet TV that cannot get the internet and cannot get the one feature we bought it for.  What's very apparent is that they want to force you to use their proprietary "apps" which include Netflix and others, and "family programs" that reuquire you to pay and "register" (i.e. provide personal information).  But the one feature that they advertise as working great "the full browser" is absolutely useless.  Samsung should be ashamed.

Reviews.Title: perfect
Reviews.Author: alejandro ruiz barraza
Reviews.Content: excellent, perfect deserve much more than 5 stars I Gave 10 commend you for your service and the item was as is described.

Reviews.Title: MISSING PIECE BASE AND MANUAL TV
Reviews.Author: Alvaro José Aguiar Silva
Reviews.Content: Dear SirsThe TV arrived yesterday, the courier: "Liberty Express", Caracas, Venezuela. The same came without a piece of the base, specifically the one that goes from the TV to the base. It also came without the instruction manual.Could you tell, it is possible, send me the missing piece and a link, the web, where you can view the manual.regardsMr. Alvaro Aguiar

Reviews.Title: Great in the daytime, terrible night viewing
Reviews.Author: Rob P
Reviews.Content: I *really* wanted to love this TV, and that's what makes writing such a negative review so hard.The problem is these TVs suffer from horrendous clouding issues, to the point where the clouding is visible when watching movies in a darkened room.My 2010 Sony Bravia 2010 Edge Lit TV had better dark performance than the Samsung.Contacted support and they are adamant in suggesting that the TV's performance is normal and clouding is a by product of the technology - they won't even swap out my set with another.I've uploaded the picture of clouding to the user images for this product - hopefully it can prevent people making the same mistake in buying this TV if they intend to watch movies in a dark environment.To sum up positives:- The feature set is fantastic- Smart tv is brilliant- Daytime picture is greatMASSIVE NEGATIVE:- Trying to watch the thing in a room with the lights off is impossible. All you will see is clouding.- Support while friendly enough won't swap out on clouding issues. This must be a directive from Samsung and makes the warranty essentially worthless.

Reviews.Title: SICK TV
Reviews.Author: Bobby - be easy
Reviews.Content: This Tv has it ALL, and I could not find a better price anywhere, and I checked around four different stores.  Great deal, Samsung is tops for TV!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV !
Reviews.Author: Anshuman Masaldan
Reviews.Content: Positives :1. Good looks, slim design2. Great picture and sound3. Good 'smart' functionality, like the apps4. 3D is excellent, with 2 sets of glasses provided with the set.Negatives1. Typing on the remote is painful, and apparently you cannot use just any bluetooth keyboard with it, need to buy it from Samsung. This is a barrier to using the smart functionality fully2. A small glitch observed recently : The 'smart' screen suddenly blinks on and off sometimes even if I havent switched it on. It just comes on for a fraction of a second and then goes away. Not sure what the reason is, but I will be contacting Samsung for it.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: Maureen "Unitarian Universalist Minister, Lif...
Reviews.Content: We've been very happy with the tv up until now.  But today the Smart Hub stopped working -- TV things it can only work on cable/antenna (neither of which we have).  No one at Samsung or on line seems able to help.  Then , after 2 hours of trying to troubleshoot we figured it out ourselves.  Which brings us back to the original opinion - great set except for the alleged keyboard.  BTW, if this happens to you and you've checked to be sure you are on line, click the box in the upper left on Smart Hub. Surprise! Everything works.

Reviews.Title: this one is very very great!
Reviews.Author: Nari Jin
Reviews.Content: i love this design and this one is very good qualrity.and HD and 3D glass is very great .

Reviews.Title: Love this TV!!!!
Reviews.Author: Kumar
Reviews.Content: Hi, I purchased this tv after doing a lot of research in web. After making the purchase, I feel that I made a right decision. The picture quality is very good. The best part is the smart features. The 3D feature is good. The web browser is awesome. The only downside is the remote is not user friendly for web browsing. I find it hard to navigate or type something in web browser. Other than this, I think this tv is worth buying. For sure, you will not get disappointed.

Reviews.Title: 120 hz or 240hz led flat panel?
Reviews.Author: pale4thrider
Reviews.Content: I guess i should have waited till Jan 2013. Prices are falling on the 8000 Samsung series. Do like picture, very thin,light, and, i do like 4 "leg" stand.Would like to have had dual core processor.....L G has with fancy remote at about same price point.If you wait one would never get anything.I will wait about a year......get rid of my Samsung lcd 1080p - pick up what's new then.

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture
Reviews.Author: Jlaw
Reviews.Content: Returned the 47 LG smart 3D led for this and so glad we did (worth the extra few bucks). The Samsung menus and remote are not as user friendly as the LG but picture and build quality are WAY better than the LG. Returned LG because a pixel went out and rear plastic behind speaker rattled when any bass tried to be produced. The Samsung feels heavier, more sturdy, picture and sound are noticeably superior. Over all all blown away by this tv every day.

Reviews.Title: Excellent !
Reviews.Author: krantiredeyes
Reviews.Content: Today is Thursday and I got this tv on monday. I love everything about it as of today. All the apps like Netflix, pandora, youtube, facebook,picasa are working fine. The bundled 3D videos are amazing to say the least. 3D effect is superb and high quality. Connectivity: I also connected my macbook pro to the tv using a HDMI cable and the clarity is just great. I can use the swipe gestures and keyboard on my macbook pro and see the display on the tv screen. I also played videos from a portable hardrive connected to the tv nicely and its very easy to access and play them. The tv as such is great looking and super slim. Super colors, great clarity and overall, it is awesome. I hope I don't get any issues with it in the future.

Reviews.Title: Consumer Reports well rated / worked as described
Reviews.Author: J. Cocuzzo
Reviews.Content: We bought this because CR rated it well, sound was supposed to be better than average for flatscreen TV.The viewing angle is not as wide as some of the more expensive LCD's or any plasma, but plasmas start at 50" and we did not have space for that wide a TV.  We find that the viewing angle is fine for our situation and would only be an issue if you need to view from well off-center position.TV sets up easily, we have it connected directly to cable thru which it can tune some HD stations and to our Tivo HD via an HDMI cable.  We got a free Samsung Blue Ray player which is on another HDMI connection and we have a Wii downstream from a mechanical video switch (so that we can toggle to a VCR/DVD player also as needed).As you'd expect, the Blue Ray Player and TV remotes play well together, being from the same Manufacturer, but I was also pleased that the Tivo remote could be programmed to control TV volume and input source and that the TV remote could be programmed to control the Tivo when switched to "STB".  The TV is also smart about figuring out whether a device is on and feeding signal.  At first I had the TV on our wireless "G" network, but I switched it to a wired ethernet connection and I found that Netflix performance was much better on the wire.  Both methods could stream movies well, but the wired connection makes "fast forward" more like a DVD or Tivo.  On the wireless, you have to pick a scene and then wait for buffering, on wired you hardly wait for buffering.A minor plus with the Samsung is the "Verizon FiOS" application that allows you to view some premium stations via the network feed and do Pay-Per-View without a set top box.  Since we returned our big set top box and use the Tivo Cable Card to tune Fios, there is a remote possibility that when the two Cable Card tuners are busy, a desired third channel would be availble thru this option.  The most typical situtation, however, is that the Tivo is busy recording and a Red Sox game is on and the Samsung does not get that station thru its Verison Fios software.  If it tuned all the subscribed FioS stations it would be a great feature.We are reasonable content with the sound from this TV, but have decided to splurge on a 5.1 "home theater in a box" system from Yamaha (597).  This has not yet arrived from Amazon.PS - the 3D feature on the TV works well, but for us it is just a novelty so far.  We watched a few of the demos, but have no Blu-Ray 3D movies.  The active glasses synch easily, but they are a bit flimsy/small and open so a bit difficult to perch in front of glasses for watching.  It works okay, but the temple pieces are so lightweight that the glasses tend to skew and you end up fussing with them to keep them in front of eyeglasses.  Possibly they should have a coupon for Lasix surgery in the box.

Reviews.Title: picture needs calibrating but still awesome!
Reviews.Author: Nick Hirata
Reviews.Content: Picture looks the smoothest in movie mode and also enhancing everything else according to your liking. Netflix runs great and smart hub comes up quick when you have a cable box. if your a gamer.......i have no advice except when you figure out how to make it look good and smooth without hurting the picture, let me know lol! So i give this a 4 out of 5 cuz the 5 out of 5's are saved for the tv's over 55 inches. And lastly, i feel the brighter you make the tv, the more lag or judder you get. Darker makes it smoother but uses alot of led battery shown when you pres "info"

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Mickey
Reviews.Content: Just what I expected. Had 55" Samsung and love it. I've had everyone brag on the picture. Haven't tried 3D.

Reviews.Title: These reviews are crazy
Reviews.Author: Chad Anderson
Reviews.Content: This TV doesn't get the credit it deserves honestly. I would with out a doubt recommend this TV to anyone. Picture is amazing, 3D is absolutely to die for.

Reviews.Title: hello
Reviews.Author: Francisco Alberto Rodriguez Useche
Reviews.Content: hello good morning very much fine excelent i am complace a e i o u del 1 al 10 les doy 10

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy a Samsung Smart TV
Reviews.Author: PC
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes of browsing the internet and watching the same free Hulu, other video, and just net browsing, as I do on my computers. The fact of it is that the browser is lousy. It does not have the same processing abilities as your computers (it takes four to five times longer to load a web page) and is limited to a very few video file formats. In fact, there is only one compatible format. So, for all practical purposes, it is not functional. The keyboard & mouse functions are also quirky, but so what, if the internet doesn't work well it's not a concern.I wasted over $ 1,000.0 to get the net on a TV and I ended up with nothing more than I had before except a TV that was 4 years newer. I really feel sorry for those who bought larger Samsungs with the same fault and paid much more.If you are interest in good surfing abilities with a TV sized display your best bet is a laptop with an HDMI port to feed the video signal to the TV. At list prices the laptop and TV display combination will cost less than a Smart Samsung TV by quite a bit.On the plus side, they do have a nice picture but so do their un-smart TVs for much less. I thought I did a fair amount of research on many brands and models. Unfortunately, I never discovered Samsung's poor web performance until a Samsung chat support person told me it was "normal". She even gave me a link describing the limitations.Note Chat Persons name has been changed to 'REP'."REP: [...]REP: You will have complete information in the above lik.REP: *link.P: are such slow downloading capabilities normal?P: I am sure the wireless is set up properlyREP: Yes, it is normal."

Reviews.Title: It very good
Reviews.Author: Surya
Reviews.Content: Amazing picture clarity and I can suggest this one of the best product in Samsung.You can choose this is the best product

Reviews.Title: Wifi Would Not Connect
Reviews.Author: susan
Reviews.Content: I will start with my first impressions and finish after TV has been with us longer.  We have had the 46" 6500 Samsung for two days and have been fighting to get the internet to connect with the router.  Very frustrating as the TV would find our network but the connection would fail.  Comcast suggested moving the router & modem to the same room as the TV. Wallah!  It worked and is at least connected. More later. Just wrote it here in case someone else was having the same problem.

Reviews.Title: cool
Reviews.Author: casey
Reviews.Content: it a good tv.yep its a good tvso you know its a good tvthe tv is good

Reviews.Title: 1080p did not work, out of the box. Very disappointed
Reviews.Author: noprofile
Reviews.Content: This was my second Samsung HDTV. The first burnt out after 5 years of regular use. I was brave enough to stick with Samsung, and this is how I was rewarded. I am returning this lemon, leaving Samsung and never looking back.

Reviews.Title: NICE TV (46" Model ES6500)
Reviews.Author: Mr D
Reviews.Content: Received tv today. Turn it on and there is thin vertical yellow line in the middle of the screen. Called Samsung customer service, they said seem like the tv is defective.==== Update 5/21/12 ====Received new tv replacement and $100 price drop refund. Thanks to Amazon awesome policy.Love the tv, 3d & streaming.Now I can buy stuffs on Amazon with confident

Reviews.Title: Completely disappointed
Reviews.Author: shopping freak
Reviews.Content: I decided to write this review after four months with my new samsung smart tv..Pros :  Very Good picture quality  Nice designCons :  Poor pricing, within 3 months price got reduced by $300  Lot of apps is not supported in 2012 model  Smart Hub is pathetic, I never use that..  Sugarsync app comes with the TV is not working and customer support for that issue is horrible..I would think twice before buying any Samsung product hereafter...

Reviews.Title: Screws don't fit
Reviews.Author: Cavalier
Reviews.Content: I recently ordered a Samsung UN46ES6500 LED TV from Amazon. Amazon's service was good. I got my TV in 2 days. My excitement didnt last long. As soon as i opened the package i found out that the M4 screws that were given with the TV don't go all the way in into the TV and TV base. When i called Samsung customer care about this issue, i was told that they can send me M4 and M3 screws in 7 to 14 business days or i can go to a local hardware store and buy screws myself. REALLY?? 7 to 14 business days? This is like buying a brand new car and finding out the keys don't fit int the ignition. Samsung's customer service is worse. And how can they just make such a fundamental mistake. I was just annoyed and submitted my replacement request in Amazon. Have to wait and see how the next one turns out.

Reviews.Title: Screws Don't Fit
Reviews.Author: Robert Smith
Reviews.Content: I received the item a few days ago. I was really exited, I opened everything up only to find that when setting it up the screws don't fit into the tv or the stand. They are too wide and don't screw in so obviously you can't put it in the stand or use it. If this happens don't expect Samsung to help you because they refused to help me. This is the second time this happened for me so I'm about to send it back for the second replacement.If anyone has run into this problem too let me know in the comments.Update: I went to my local hardware store and the man who helped me told me that the screws which they provided had to much "pitch" which means that the tread count was higher than the hole it was supposed to go in.

Reviews.Title: PERFECT.....
Reviews.Author: ENRIQUE
Reviews.Content: ESTE TV ES PERFECTO NO NECESITAS LA VERSION SERIE 7000 PUES SON DIFERENCIAS INNECESARIAS, Y MAS ECONOMICO QUE LA VERSION ANTERIOR, 5 ESTRELLAS

Reviews.Title: A Downgraded TV
Reviews.Author: Kozie
Reviews.Content: I received this unit as a replacent for the UND6000 of which a black line appeared horizontally across the screen within 24 days of purchase.  The exchange dept answered my detailed questions about the specs since it had just came out that day. He sounded like he knew what he was talking about. When I received the TV, some things were left out and deceit started to show. There is only one component/composite connection. All input ports except 2 USB and 1 HDMI  are on the back just in over 1/4th of the TVs size. I'm unable to access those ports due to my "universal" wall mount. This worked with 3 other Samsung TVs as well as all other brands. 2012's change has made it so you either have to purchase a Samsung mount or the spidered out mount. My mount is pretty expensive and can hold a tv from 32"-70". This is very frustrating.Secondly, there is annoying beep on the TV when you push the volume buttons or when navigating with directional pad.  Can't find an "off" option anywhere.I would wait until later in the year to purchase the 2012 TVs. It seems as if their agenda is to quickly make and get it out now. Let them fix the issues first. Why would you downgrade from 1 component and 2 composite connections anyways? Doesn't make sense to me at all.Besides those, pretty good picture, sound and web connectivity.

Reviews.Title: Never going to Order through Amazon again
Reviews.Author: Suman Padullaparti
Reviews.Content: I took Amazon Prime membership and ordered this item expecting this to be delivered before Christmas. I has a nightmare because of Amazon and UPS. UPS tried to deliver this on Thursday and I was not available. Driver left a note on my door saying that he will deliver it on Friday. I took a paid time off to receive the package and driver never showed up. Then I scheduled pickup from UPS warehouse and waited at UPS warehouse for 3 hours on Christmas eve. Finally they told me they lost my package. Really, they lost a 46 Inch TV???I immediately cancelled the order.Amazon called me and said they don't want to lose my business so I ordered the same TV again and this time I got the TV in time but it is not working. Half of the screen turned white and was showing no image. Now I am here spending 1000$ and all my time on Christmas eve and New Years Eve without TV.Returning the broken TV is a hassle because there is no option to dropoff and I had to again wait for the UPS guys to come and pick it up.My friends ordered the same TV from other sites and they are happy. After been so log with Amazon, I expect more effort from them in customer satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Junk!!!
Reviews.Author: biged
Reviews.Content: Just got around to reviewing this TV as I was waiting to see if would hold up. Well, it didn't! Had it 3 years and it crapped out. Called Samsung and they were sorry to hear about it and that my unit did not qualify for a issue that they are having with capacitors failing on certain units. Ordered a 120Hz unit and received a 60Hz. I personally believe a TV should last longer than 3 years!!! If plan on buying one, expect problems and purchase an extended warranty plan to cover the expense for repair. Ordered another TV and it is not a SAMSUNG!!
